result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mason X McMurtrey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Mason X McMurtrey.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. Plea hearing proceeded. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Court vacates the scheduled jury trial. Defendant to appear by zoom on the next court date. Case adjourned for sentencing and restitution hearing in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Witness List.  Received and FIled.  nk

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Mason X McMurtrey not in court, in custody in juvenile detention.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Alex Geocaris the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Jordan Hemmings - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Reserve Branch, Judge Franke.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is out sick. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mason X McMurtrey not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with A.D.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving at all.

Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Mason X McMurtrey in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
